content: Gary Hsieh curriculum vitae Human Centered Design & Engineering University of Washington garyhs@uw.edu 414 Sieg Hall, Campus Box 352315 University of Washington Seattle, WA 98195 P: +1 (206) 543 9747 F: +1 (206) 543 9747 Introduction I am a professor in the Department of Human Centered Design & Engineering (HCDE) and an adjunct professor in the Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering at University of Washington. I am also affiliated with the Center for an Informed Public. My research group, Prosocial Computing Group, focuses on understanding, designing, and developing technologies that encourage people to communicate and interact in ways that are self- and welfare-improving. We extend and build on theories from a number of fields, including psychology, communication and economics. Our application areas include behavior change, online support and Q&A, and civic and local participation. I was previously faculty at Michigan State University with a joint appointment in Communication and Media and Information. I received my PhD in Human-Computer Interaction from the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University. My research has been supported by National Science Foundation, National Institute of Health, Center for Disease Control and Prevention, Fulbright, Nokia, Intel, Microsoft, Google, UW ALACRITY Center, and Institute of Translational Health Sciences. I have served as an academic consultant for Twitter, Philips Healthcare, and Rulai. Interested in Research? I work with graduate and undergraduate students who are intersted in human-computer interaction, social computing, behavior change, translational science, and related topics. Send me an email to schedule a 30 minutes meeting. Please include: Why Me? There are a lot of great faculty in HCDE at UW. Why do you want to work with me specifically? Is there some interest you have related to my recent publications? Your Background and Skills. Are you good at design? Can you code? Are you a good writer? Have you conducted experiments? Can you interview? Send me some samples or a link to your portfolio. I work with students with a variety of backgrounds. This info will help me decide if there are any projects that you might be able to contribute to. News Launched Paper2Card Tool to translate academic papers into design cards. Try it and give us feedback!
